case_vignette:
A 50-year-old female with no pertinent medical history presents with a two year history of dark spots on the face. She noticed the dark spots when applying make up one day. She denies any pruritus, pain, trauma or use of any new topical skin products. The dark spots have increased in number and may have slightly grown in size. She has not tried any treatments. Physical examination reveals brown irregular patchy poorly demarcated macules coalescing into patches on the bilateral zygomatic cheeks with some extension on lateral cheeks.  The patient is a 50-year-old female with no pertinent medical history. She has a two year history of dark spots on the face. She noticed the dark spots when applying make up one day. She denies any pruritus, pain, trauma or use of any new topical skin products. The dark spots have increased in number and may have slightly grown in size. She has not tried any treatments. Physical examination reveals brown irregular patchy poorly demarcated macules coalescing into patches on the bilateral zygomatic cheeks with some extension on lateral cheeks.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have dark spots on my face that have been increasing in number and may have grown a little in size over the past two years.
How old are you and what is your gender?
I am a 50-year-old female.
Have you had any recent sun exposure or do you regularly use sunscreen?
No, I haven't had any significant recent sun exposure or used any new topical skin products, including sunscreen.
Do these dark spots have a rough texture or are they smooth?
The dark spots on my face are smooth; they do not have a rough texture.
Have you noticed any changes in their color or do they itch or bleed?
No, they have not changed color, and they do not itch or bleed.
Do you have a family history of skin conditions or any similar symptoms in your family?
I have no pertinent medical history, including family history related to skin conditions or similar symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Solar Lentigines
